children.subject: Not sure why it still says "Fall 2014", but my friend noticed that the search results give the times for Fall 2015 and told me about it.
Is the schedule for fall15 up? Where did you see it?

history.content: I believe this is a preference of professor Kubi. I'm currently a TA, and I'll try and bring this up during the next staff meeting.

The combination of very narrow overlap between Prof Kubiatowicz's desired teaching times and campus room availability means that it will always be taught at either MW 5-6:30P or MW 6:30-8P when he is teaching the class.  We can put classes of 100 or fewer projected students in department space but 162 will be too large for us to have that flexibility.  Given other instructors desire to teach MW with classes of larger than 100 students (in this case CS186) and our attempt not to have large upper division courses conflict with each other whenever possible, sometimes this class will be taught at 6:30P-8P for Fall 2015.

The combination of very narrow overlap between Prof Kubiatowicz's desired teaching times and campus room availability mean that it will always be taught at either MW 5-6:30P or MW 6:30-8P when he is teaching the class.  We can put classes of 100 or fewer projected students in department space but 162 will be too large for us to have that flexibility.  Given other instructors desire to teach MW with classes of larger than 100 students (in this case CS186) and our attempt not to have large upper division courses conflict with each other whenever possible, sometimes this class will be taught at 6:30P-8P for Fall 2015.

children.subject: To be fair, I'm personally more tired in the morning/afternoon, so morning or early afternoon classes are worse for me. That being said, 162 will probably be webcasted.

@Vaishaal
Only if Kubi doesn't mind sharing -- do you know why he likes late classes?

history.content:
Looking at the schedule of classes, I noticed that the timing for CS 162 is MW 6:30-8P. I was looking forward to taking this class, but my personal experience has been that people are generally tired and don't learn as well so late in the evening. Many of my classmates and I would prefer classes earlier in the day so that we can concentrate and get the most out of lecture.

In my experience, it has been very unusual to have classes held so late. Is there any possibility that the time of CS 162 lecture will be changed to something in the morning/afternoon?
history.subject: CS 162 Fall 2015
